item.title: Trump Discusses Ukraine Red Lines With Europe Before Putin Summit
item.description: European leaders and Ukraine’s Zelensky agree on core points with Trump ahead of his meeting with the Russian leader.
item.dc:creator: Bojan Pancevski

item.title: Opinion | Evidence Backs Trump on Higher Ed’s Bias
item.description: A massive database shows college courses dealing with race and the Middle East lean sharply left.
item.dc:creator: Yuval Avnur

item.title: Israel’s Military Chief Under Fire From Netanyahu Government
item.description: A dispute over the course of the war in Gaza sparks public attacks from the far-right.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Seven Pivotal Moments as the U.S. Wrestles With Russia’s Invasion of Ukraine
item.description: From frail alliances to the bully pulpit, former President Joe Biden and President Trump have tried different approaches to end the three-year war.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: JD Vance’s English Countryside Vacation: Rolling Hills, Armored SUVs and Cranky Locals
item.description: The vice president is the most high-profile recent American visitor to the Cotswolds, an idyll that locals say is being disrupted by too many Yanks.
item.dc:creator: Roya Shahidi

item.title: Ahead of Trump-Putin Meeting, Zelensky Says He Won’t Exchange Land for Peace
item.description: Ukraine’s president shrugged off the suggestion that a land swap with Russia could be part of a cease-fire agreement in the near term.
item.dc:creator: Ian Lovett

item.title: The South African Businessman Who Turned Le Creuset Into Commercial Gold
item.description: Paul van Zuydam led the struggling French company to a global kitchenware powerhouse.
item.dc:creator: Jaden Urbi

item.title: Switzerland Asks Whether Its Famed Neutrality Is Fit for the Modern World
item.description: Trump’s tariffs force the home of Davos to consider appealing to the U.S. or forming closer ties with the EU.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Ukraine’s Once Nimble Army Is Mired in Soviet Decision-Making
item.description: As U.S.-Russia summit approaches, Ukrainian military faces growing divisions between the rank-and-file and top brass
item.dc:creator: Ian Lovett

item.title: Opinion | Europe’s Free-Trade Fumble
item.description: They pound on Trump and then kill a trade pact of their own with Mercosur countries.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Mexico Transfers 26 Suspected Cartel Members to U.S.
item.description: President Trump has urged Mexico’s Claudia Sheinbaum to dismantle drug organizations.
item.dc:creator: José de Córdoba

item.title: Opinion | Expand the Abraham Accords to Azerbaijan and Beyond
item.description: Opportunities abound for the U.S. and Israel in the Caucasus and Central Asia.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Epstein

item.title: Opinion | Trump’s Drive-By Summit With Putin
item.description: The American president has chutzpah and an instinct for U.S. interests. What he’s missing is a strategy.
item.dc:creator: Holman W. Jenkins, Jr.

item.title: Opinion | If the U.S. Doesn’t Set Global Tech Standards, China Will
item.description: Beijing wants to control how much freedom people have online by making the rules for new technologies.
item.dc:creator: Luke Hogg

item.title: Opinion | How Hamas Fools the World
item.description: The terror group has perfected the war-crimes playbook on how to win antisemitic friends and influence useful idiots.

item.title: Russian Military Makes Surprise Push in Ukraine Ahead of Trump Talks
item.description: Infantry soldiers have made a small penetration in eastern Ukraine. Kyiv’s military said it is counterattacking.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: China Creates World’s No. 1 Shipbuilder, Driven by Rivalry With U.S.
item.description: In a $16 billion merger, Beijing is looking to counter President Trump’s moves to rebuild American shipyards.
item.dc:creator: Costas Paris

item.title: Refugees in Africa Fight Over Food as U.S. Aid Cuts Take Hold
item.description: The impact of America’s cuts is rippling across the continent.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Russia Has High Hopes for Trump-Putin Summit. Peace Isn’t One of Them.
item.description: The meeting represents a victory for Russian President Vladimir Putin, who seeks to end international isolation and separate Russian ties with the U.S. from the fate of Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Yaroslav Trofimov

item.title: With Billions at Risk, Nvidia CEO Buys His Way Out of the Trade Battle
item.description: Jensen Huang tried diplomacy to sell chips in China, but it took a last-minute deal with the White House.
item.dc:creator: Amrith Ramkumar

item.title: Israel Killed Five Al Jazeera Journalists in Airstrike, Network Says
item.description: Israel accused Anas Al-Sharif of heading a Hamas cell, allegations his network denied.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: European Leaders Plan to Meet Trump Before Putin Talks
item.description: Trump says he would abandon talks with the Russian president if he senses an agreement on Ukraine can’t be reached.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: EU Clears $4.8 Billion Prosus-Just Eat Deal With Conditions
item.description: The European Commission approved the merger after the Naspers subsidiary offered concessions to ease competition concerns.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: Colombian Presidential Hopeful Dies Two Months After Campaign Event Shooting
item.description: Sen. Miguel Uribe, who warned Colombia was reverting to its bloody past, was shot in the head amid a surge in violence.
item.dc:creator: Juan Forero

item.title: The Engineering Marvel That China Hopes Will Help Wean It Off Foreign Energy
item.description: A giant hydropower project at the edge of the Tibetan plateau represents a spectacular feat of engineering—and an unsettling prospect for the nations downstream.
item.dc:creator: Austin Ramzy

item.title: The American Fighting to Pry His Company Back From the Kremlin’s Grasp
item.description: Leonid Smirnov built Russia’s biggest canned foods company. With the stroke of a pen, Putin’s government took it over.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: China Detains Senior Diplomat Who Aided U.S. Relations
item.description: Liu Jianchao received a warm reception during a 2024 visit to Washington and New York where he was seen as a potential foreign minister.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Israel’s New War Plan Includes Fighting in Gaza’s Central Refugee Camps
item.description: Israel’s prime minister revealed the previously undisclosed objective amid pressure internationally and at home.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Ukraine and Europe Counter Putin’s Cease-Fire Proposal
item.description: The alternative blueprint to end the war comes after Russia demanded major territorial concessions and President Trump said he would meet with Vladimir Putin this week.
item.dc:creator: Yaroslav Trofimov

item.title: Armies Tormented by Drones Innovate Ways to Spot, Jam and Zap on the Cheap
item.description: Equipment including computerized rifle sights and backpack-portable jammers was recently tested by the U.S. Army. The goal is to have technology that is cheaper than the drones themselves.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: 9/11 Families See Lutnick, Who Lost Brother in Attack, as Last Hope for Justice
item.description: Relatives of people killed in the attacks call on Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick to demand that the Saudi government “accept responsibility for the actions of their predecessors.”
item.dc:creator: Natalie Andrews

item.title: Why India Can’t Afford to Jettison Its Relationship With Russia
item.description: Despite the threat of U.S. tariffs, New Delhi is resisting pressure to cut longtime ties with Moscow that have brought economic and geopolitical benefits.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Just as Russia’s Most-Famous Dissident Seemed Set to Go Free, Tragedy Struck
item.description: Alexei Navalny’s death in prison cut short a high-stakes swap pushed by a U.S. diplomat who went rogue.
item.dc:creator: Drew Hinshaw

item.title: Deep in the Amazon, the Gospel Arrives by Boat
item.description: Evangelical Christianity is spreading fast across the Amazon. The spiritual battle is reshaping the world’s biggest rainforest, environmentalists and indigenous leaders say.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: Putin Tells U.S. He’ll Halt War in Exchange for Eastern Ukraine
item.description: Trump said he would meet with the Russian leader in Alaska on Aug. 15, following Putin’s proposal. Hours later, Ukraine’s Zelensky ruled out giving up land.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Gaza Takeover Plan Exposes Constraints on Israeli Military
item.description: Operation will start with a limited move to take over Gaza City, as troop constraints and war-weariness hit home.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: How Much Damage Can Trump’s Campaign Against Russian Oil Inflict on Moscow?
item.description: Lower prices give President Trump more room to maneuver than Joe Biden had. Will it be enough to force Vladimir Putin to accept a cease-fire in Ukraine?
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Why Poor Nations Got Hit With Higher Tariffs Than Rich Ones
item.description: In a new era of gloves-off trade negotiations, poorer countries had the least leverage with a country the size of the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Vance’s British Vacation Is Latest Sign of White House’s Soft Spot for U.K.
item.description: Vice President JD Vance arrived in Britain to kick off a 10-day visit that includes a weekend stay with U.K. Foreign Secretary David Lammy, followed by a family holiday.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Andrews

item.title: Israel’s Plan to Expand War Raises Fears for Gazans, Hostages
item.description: Germany moves to suspend arms sales as Israel’s decision risks deepening international isolation.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Israeli Security Cabinet Approves Gaza Control Plan
item.description: Israel’s security cabinet approved a plan for the military to take control of Gaza City after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu pledged to take over the entire enclave.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: Could the U.S. Have Saved Navalny?
item.description: As the Biden administration deliberated, friends of the famous Russian opposition leader rallied behind an audacious plan to spring him from Putin’s gulag.
item.dc:creator: Joe Parkinson

item.title: North Korean, Wrapped in Plastic Foam, Floats to Freedom in the South
item.description: The man swam down the coast and evaded armed border guards with orders to shoot anyone fleeing Kim Jong Un’s regime.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Bank of England Cuts Rates After Tight Vote
item.description: The U.K. central bank lowered its key rate for the fifth time in a year as it seeks to balance a pickup in inflation against a cooling jobs market.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: World’s Longest Suspension Bridge to Link Sicily to Mainland Italy
item.description: The Italian government said the bridge would be a security asset, which allows it to categorize the project as a military expense and count it toward its NATO spending commitments.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: North Korea Capitalizes on Russia’s Help by Expanding Satellite Launching Facility
item.description: A new seaport suggests Pyongyang wants to accelerate deliveries of large Russian components, as military ties between the two nations grow.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: India Defies Trump on Russian Oil Despite Tariff Threats
item.description: Indian experts believe the U.S. president is trying to gain short-term leverage in trade negotiations with New Delhi.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: North Korea Refuses to Claim Body of Dead Citizen Held by the South
item.description: The denial of the routine handover comes as South Korea’s new leader tries to improve ties with Pyongyang.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Brazil’s Supreme Court Orders Ex-President Bolsonaro Under House Arrest for Defying Court Order
item.description: Justice Alexandre de Moraes accuses the right-wing leader of violating a social-media ban.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: Mexico’s Drug Cartels Bedevil Sheinbaum’s Dealmaking With Trump
item.description: The Mexican president wants to reach an agreement with the U.S. to further cooperate on security, but she has been undermined by the cartels’ pervasive influence.
item.dc:creator: José de Córdoba

item.title: China Is Choking Supply of Critical Minerals to Western Defense Companies
item.description: Beijing is squeezing the flow of key elements needed to make defense systems, a sign of the leverage China has over the U.S. military supply chain.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: Trump’s Warm Embrace of India Turns Cold
item.description: Trade disputes and ties with Russia rankle the president, threatening to sink the U.S.-India relationship.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Inside Kim Jong Un’s New Beach Resort, Where the Only Foreigners Are Russian
item.description: The first batch of outsiders were met with free jet-ski rides, an abundance of food and a $465 toy version of the Hwasong-17 missile.
item.dc:creator: Kate Vtorygina

item.title: In a Country Trump Says Nobody’s Heard Of, Tariffs Bring Chaos
item.description: President Trump promised Africa that trade would replace aid, but in one of the world’s poorest countries his administration is slashing both.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: China Politburo Holds off on Further Stimulus
item.description: The country’s top policymaking body pledged to better execute policies that are already in place.

item.title: Trump Sought Escape on His Summer Golf Vacation. Some Scots Thought Otherwise.
item.description: A small group of protesters greeted the president at his golf course on Scotland’s west coast.
item.dc:creator: James Hookway

item.title: Hopes Rise for U.S.-Europe Trade Deal as Trump Visits Scotland
item.description: Trump and Ursula von der Leyen, a top EU top official, are set to meet Sunday during president’s golf trip.
item.dc:creator: Kim Mackrael

item.title: U.K. Government Will Stick to Budget Rules, Treasury Chief Says
item.description: The U.K. government will continue to stick to its budget rules despite a series of challenges that include big changes in geopolitics and trade, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Africa Wants Its Critical Minerals to Yield Jobs, Not Just Dollars
item.description: The Trump administration wants to cut deals to secure more of the key materials, but African countries are imposing export restrictions to help develop their own industries.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Congo Braces for HIV Surge After U.S. Funding Stops
item.description: U.S. funded treatments in the country have helped reduce deaths from HIV/AIDS to around 14,000 a year, from as high as 200,000.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: The Coup Leader Who’s Become an Anti-Western Hero in Africa and Beyond
item.description: Ibrahim Traoré, Burkina Faso’s leader, counts admirers from Nairobi to Jamaica and London. Russia is also courting him.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Air India Crash Investigators Recover Black Boxes as Death Toll Hits 265
item.description: An early focus of the probe includes a possible loss or reduction of thrust.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Tangel

item.title: The Man in Seat 11A Who Walked Away From the Air India Crash
item.description: Britain’s Viswashkumar Ramesh said he doesn’t know why he survived, while more than 200 others, including his brother, died. In India, he has become known as the miracle of window seat 11A.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
